DOC.brief_summary: Mapping Human Muscle Satellite Cell Fate By Real-Time Imaging
DOC.brief_title: Mapping Human Muscle Satellite Cell Fate By Real-Time Imaging
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of this study is to obtain human muscle samples for cell culturing to analyze muscle cell development in real-time to uncover factors that influence growth.
DOC.criteria: men 2029 yrs BMI between 20 and 34.9 Fasting Glucose <110 mg/dL Blood Pressure <160/100mm Hg NonDiabetic LDLCholesterol <160mg/dL Triacylglycerol <400 mg/dL Makers of kidney, liver, and heart functions within 10% of clinical normalcy <1.5hr /wk of habitual aerobic exercise training and no resistance exercise training in the past 6 months men <20or>29 yrs BMI between <20 and >34.9 Fasting Glucose >110 mg/dL Blood Pressure >160/100mm Hg NonDiabetic LDLCholesterol >160mg/dL Triacylglycerol >400 mg/dL Preexisting kidney or liver conditions >1.5hr /wk of habitual aerobic exercise training and no resistance exercise training in the past 6 months Currently taking prescribed blood thinners
